definitions.example: Next time, let's ask a group with a different mix up.
I refuse to send them any more money until they fix this mix up.

definitions.definition: To mix or blend thoroughly and completely.
definitions.example: She mixed up peat moss, humus, and compost to make potting soil.
All the smells of the food had mixed up together.

definitions.definition: To prepare something from ingredients that are mixed.
definitions.example: She mixed up a batch of her own potting soil.
I always mix up Jack with Jake.

definitions.definition: (usually passive, with with, often with be or get) To become involved with, especially socially or romantically.
definitions.example: He got mixed up with a bad crowd.
